description: Prime Minister Michel Barnier warned lawmakers that France has reached its “moment of truth,” as far-right leader Marine Le Pen is set to join a left-wing coalition to topple his government as soon as this week.
title: France Faces ‘Moment of Truth’ With Government on Brink of Collapse

description: The ongoing legal drama over Hunter Biden ended abruptly when his father, US President Joe Biden, pardoned him for tax and gun charges despite vowing not to do so.
title: Why Biden’s Pardon of His Son Is So Controversial

description: The rekindling of fighting in Syria comes after a four-year lull in a civil war that first broke out in 2011. The uneasy stalemate among the country’s various hostile factions was broken when rebel fighters captured the city of Aleppo from President Bashar al-Assad’s regime and another rebel group took a smaller city north of there from Syrian Kurdish forces.
title: Who’s Fighting and Why in the Revived Syrian War

description: President-elect Donald Trump is nominating investment banker Warren Stephens to be the US ambassador to the United Kingdom, tapping a prominent Republican donor and businessman for a prime diplomatic post in his second administration.
title: Trump Picks Investment Banker Warren Stephens as UK Ambassador

description: Mexico’s analysts are predicting a negative turn in the business climate in the next six months in the wake of Donald Trump’s victory in the US presidential election.
title: Mexican Business Climate to Worsen After Trump Win, Analysts Say

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, congressional correspondent Steven T. Dennis looks at Trump’s confrontational approach to filling out his administration. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Some Trump Nominees May Test His Hold on Senate Republicans

description: The UK doesn’t need to trade off its special relationship with the US against its European alliances, Prime Minister Keir Starmer said, despite concern that President-elect Donald Trump’s plans to to ramp-up tariffs will drive a wedge between the allies.
title: UK Won’t Choose Between Trump and European Allies, Starmer Says

description: Hezbollah has claimed the first strike against Israel since a US-backed cease-fire plan came into effect less than a week ago, prompting Israeli officials to vow a strong response in the most serious threat so far to the truce with Lebanon.
title: Hezbollah Fires Toward Israel, Risking US-Brokered Cease-Fire

description: President Joe Biden’s public justification of his decision to pardon his son — accusing the Justice Department of political targeting — threatens to undermine the image he carefully cultivated through decades in politics as an honest broker whose principal loyalty was to protecting the sanctity of critical US institutions.
title: Biden’s Pardon of Son Threatens to Tarnish Legacy, Empower Trump

description: Colombia’s finance chief has been hit with fresh accusations in an alleged corruption scandal, adding to complications for President Gustavo Petro just as the government tries to navigate a deepening fiscal crisis.
title: Corruption Scandal Adds to Pressure on Colombia’s Finance Minister

description: France’s government risks collapse before the end of the week, with potentially painful economic and financial consequences.
title: What Happens If French Government Falls After Budget Showdown

description: Romania’s top court validated the outcome of a key presidential vote, approving the candidacy of a pro-Russian candidate for a runoff with high geopolitical stakes for the nation on NATO’s eastern flank.
title: Romanian Court Clears Pro-Russian Candidate for Runoff Vote

description: Syria-based rebel forces are seeking to build on recent gains and capture more territory controlled by the government, raising the question of whether President Bashar Al-Assad can hold onto power.
title: Syria’s Assad and Iran Face Tough Choices as Rebels Advance

description: Georgia’s premier ruled out holding talks with the opposition after four nights of violent clashes in the capital helped propel the lari to a two-year low against the dollar.
title: Georgia Premier Rules Out Talks With Opposition After EU-Protest Clashes

description: Tunisia’s government is looking to the central bank to help repay its external debt for a second straight year, as the economy languishes after a potential International Monetary Fund bailout stalled.
title: Tunisia Looks to Central Bank to Repay Debt as Economy Flails

description: The world’s biggest hedge funds made the most of trading opportunities sparked by Donald Trump’s reelection last month, keeping the industry on track to post its strongest returns in at least four years.
title: Biggest Hedge Funds Make the Most of the Trump Trade in November

description: Mozambique’s main opposition leader called for another seven days of protests against what he’s called fraudulent elections, a move that threatens to extend weeks of unrest that has left dozens dead.
title: Mozambique Braces For Another Week of Election Protests

description: Marine Le Pen pledged to topple Prime Minister Michel Barnier’s government after he failed to meet her demands on a new budget, threatening financial and political disruption for France.
title: France’s Far Right Aims to Topple Government Over New Budget Law

description: Greece isn’t planning to impose any extraordinary tax on its banks, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Greece Tells Investors It Has No Plans for Extra Tax on Banks

description: French Prime Minister Michel Barnier used a constitutional tool to push through parts of his unpopular budget bill without a parliamentary vote, raising the prospect lawmakers could dissolve his government within a matter of days.
title: Barnier Risks Government Collapse With French Budget Gambit

description: The UK will “war-game” how well its domestic supply chain and military can withstand future shocks, as the government prepares a clearer commitment on when it will increase defense spending.
title: UK Looks to Bolster Military Supply Chain Ahead of 2.5% Goal

description: French Prime Minister Michel Barnier will use a constitutional tool to push through parts of his unpopular budget bill without a parliamentary vote, LCI television said.
title: French Govt to Adopt Social Security Bill Without Vote: LCI TV

description: California Governor Gavin Newsom wants to allocate as much as $25 million to challenge President-elect Donald Trump’s most aggressive policies with a battalion of lawyers.
title: California Eyes $25 Million Legal Battle Against Trump Policies

description: Hungary’s most popular politician Peter Magyar has a plan to end his country’s economic crisis: defeat Prime Minister Viktor Orban in the next election, bring home frozen European Union funds and steer the country toward euro adoption.
title: Orban’s Rival Vows to End Hungary Crisis by Unlocking EU Funds

description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer named Chris Wormald as the country’s top civil servant, promoting the veteran official in a move designed to bring stability to the top of government after a rocky first five months in office.
title: Starmer Appoints Chris Wormald to Head UK’s Civil Service

description: Donald Trump’s nominee to run the Department of Defense, Fox News host Pete Hegseth, was forced to resign from two veterans’ advocacy groups amid allegations of personal and financial misconduct, the New Yorker reported.
title: Hegseth Quit Vets Groups Over Misconduct Claims, New Yorker Says

description: France’s government offered a final-hour concession to Marine Le Pen on the 2025 budget, seeking to avoid being ousted from power in a no-confidence vote.
title: French Premier Offers Final-Hour Budget Concession to Le Pen

description: The European Union’s executive arm plans to present next month the outlines of a plan for how to boost the bloc’s competitiveness with the US and China as it pursues an ambitious clean-tech overhaul.
title: EU’s New Leadership to Outline Competitiveness Plan Next Month

description: European Union member states are nearing a deal on a new €1.5 billion ($1.6 billion) defense fund to help bolster the industry in the bloc and Ukraine over the next three years.
title: EU Nears Deal on €1.5 Billion Fund to Boost Its Defense Industry

description: A conservative Russian tycoon and Kremlin confidant said he believes Moscow will turn down any Ukraine ceasefire offer brokered by incoming US President Donald Trump.
title: Putin Ally Predicts Russia Will Reject Trump’s Ukraine Truce Bid

description: Iceland began the work to form a new ruling coalition after opposition Social Democrats won Saturday’s elections on the Atlantic island.
title: Iceland Starts Coalition-Building After Social Democrats Win

description: Argentina would seem to have it all — abundant natural resources, legions of well-educated workers. But it struggles to attract investors because its politicians have a habit of changing the rules on a whim, favoring the state over private enterprise.
title: Milei Touts $50 Billion From Investors Eyeing 30-Year Loopholes in Argentina

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: A Dormant War in Syria Has Just Reignited

description: Colombia’s president called last week for hundreds of mercenaries from the South American country fighting in Sudan to return home, a sign of how private military contractors have proliferated across Africa to lead the fight against armies, rebel groups and Islamist insurgents.
title: Colombians in Sudan Show Rise of Military Contractors in Africa

description: Germany’s top diplomat said Chinese-made drones that Russia is using in Ukraine are hurting Europe, sharpening her criticism of the Asian nation before the likely unveiling of EU sanctions.
title: German Foreign Minister Says Chinese-Made Drones Hurting Europe

description: South Africa’s government said there are no plans to create a so-called BRICS currency, after US President-elect Donald Trump threatened to impose 100% tariffs on members of the economic bloc that back the creation of an alternative to the US dollar.
title: South Africa Says No Plans to Develop a Common BRICS Currency

description: A member of Poland’s central bank’s management board was detained by police on Monday to make him cooperate with a parliamentary investigation into the use of Pegasus spyware under the previous government.
title: Poland Detains Central Bank Board Member in Pegasus Spyware Case

description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol faces another test of his leadership as the main opposition party vies to control the annual budget, an outcome that would cast further doubt on his ability to enact policy as the nation braces for Donald Trump’s return.
title: South Korea Budget Tussle Tests Yoon Ahead of Trump’s Return

description: National Rally President Jordan Bardella toughened the stance of the far-right in France’s budget debate, increasing the likelihood that the government will be toppled as soon as this week.
title: Far-Right Chief Vows to Sink French Government Unless ‘Miracle’

description: The Philippines said a Chinese Navy chopper harassed Filipino fishing boats at a disputed South China Sea reef, showing lingering tensions in the key waterway.
title: Philippines Sends Ships to Reef After China ‘Harassment’

description: On his visit to Angola, the president will stress US support for infrastructure aimed at countering Chinese influence in the region.
title: The Billion-Dollar Railway Driving Biden’s Africa Trip

description: Governments and companies are desperate to reverse the trend of absences
title: Rising Sick Days Are Costing Europe Billions Every Year

description: Ireland’s dominant political parties appear to have bucked the global trend of frustrated voters ousting incumbents, helped in part by a large pile of cash at their disposal to back election promises.
title: Irish Incumbents Set to Hold Power, Bucking Global Vote Trend

description: French President Emmanuel Macron lands in Riyadh on Monday for a two-day state visit, with fighter jets and geopolitical turbulence featuring high on his itinerary.
title: Macron Heads to Riyadh With Defense Deals, Mideast on Agenda

description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. said the reported presence of a Russian submarine in the Southeast Asian nation’s waters is “very concerning.”
title: Marcos Calls Russian Sub in South China Sea ‘Very Worrisome’

description: Statement from President Joe Biden
title: Full Text: Here’s Biden’s Full Statement on Why He Pardoned Son Hunter

description: The Communist Party’s elite decision-making body skipped releasing a readout for its regular November meeting, a rare omission that comes as investors are hungry for any signs of more stimulus.
title: China Skips Politburo Readout as Investors Await Stimulus Clues

description: Micheal Martin has insisted it is time to "get on with the work" after hailing his Fianna Fail party's performance in Ireland's general election.
title: Martin Says Time to 'Get on With the Work' Following Ireland's General Election

description: Full written statement from President Joe Biden on his decision to pardon his son:
title: Full Text: Biden’s Written Statement on Pardoning Son Hunter

description: President Joe Biden said that he signed a pardon for his son Hunter Biden, reversing his previous stance that he would not use his executive powers to aid his family member.
title: Biden Says He Pardoned His Son Hunter in Reversal for President

description: UK defense companies will be prioritized for government contracts to ensure Britain has a resilient domestic supply chain that can “innovate at a wartime pace” under a strategy that creates jobs and boosts growth, the government will announce on Monday.
title: New UK Defense Strategy to Give Priority to Local Firms, Growth

description: Business activity in the UK is on course to shrink for the first time in more than two years as companies cut jobs and rein in investment following the October budget, according to the Confederation of British Industry’s monthly growth indicator.
title: UK Business Tax Raid Crashing Private Sector, CBI Survey Finds

description: The biggest challenge to Bashar al-Assad’s regime seemingly came out of nowhere, and as Aleppo fell to Turkish-backed rebels in a matter of days, the Syrian president reportedly flew to Moscow.
title: Syria Flares Up With Russia and Iran Fighting Other Conflicts
